page.title: 02Our Visit to Cattows Farm
page.content: Most of the farms near Heather are quite big. At one time many of them had big herds of milking cows. Today some have changed to stock-rearing and arable farming. We visited Cattows Farm and we found out that the farmer had to get up early to feed the cattle. They dont have any milking cows any more, and in the summer months they spend a lot of time doing jobs in the fields. In spring time they are busy fencing and spreading fertilizer on the grass. In the early summer they start harvesting the silage, and the cattle are "wormed" so that they stay healthy. They have three hundred Friesian and Hereford cows on the farm. They grow barley, hay and wheat. The farmer and his brother work the farm. Altogether they have 275 acres.
